lead_paragraph: Ever since California voters defeated an obscure ballot measure called Proposition 3 on Election Day, the state's election officials and party leaders have had an almost panicky look about them. Here's why: Under rules established by the Democratic and Republican national parties, delegates to Presidential nominating conventions must be chosen in closed primaries and caucuses -- that is, primaries and caucuses in which Democrats vote only for Democrats, and Republicans vote only for Republicans.
abstract: Comment on political ramifications of decision by California voters, rejecting Proposition 3 to return to closed primary system for choosing Presidential candidates (S)
